response.original_title: Arizona Performance: Resolving TotalAV "High CPU Usage" and Fan Noise
response.overview: Arizona Performance Line: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: Arizona users frequently report that TotalAV makes their hardware noisy and hot. Technically, this is caused by Scanning Overlap. If the "Scheduled Scan" triggers while the real-time engine is monitoring active 2026 AI-web traffic, the CPU's Interrupt Requests (IRQ) spike. In Arizona’s heat, this leads to Thermal Throttling, where the CPU stays at 100% usage but the PC feels frozen. Advanced Restoration Protocols: IRQ Priority Re-alignment: Adjust TotalAV’s process priority to "Low" to reduce CPU heat generation. Scheduled Scan Calibration: Disable "Scan while Idle" to prevent background CPU spikes during high Arizona ambient heat. Power Option Optimization: Change the Windows Power Plan to "High Performance" to prevent the CPU from entering a low-voltage "lag" state.
